Reason: The truncate_request_timeout_in_ms configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can directly impact the timeout for truncating requests, which can affect the overall system performance. If the timeout is set too low, it may lead to incomplete truncation operations and potential data inconsistencies. On the other hand, setting it too high can result in longer wait times and increased resource consumption, impacting system responsiveness and efficiency.
